demolition

Class Explosion

  • java.lang.Object
    • demolition.Entity
      • demolition.Explosion

  • public class Explosion
extends Entity
    This is used to handle functions relevant to a particular explosion. A single Explosion is defined as the portion of an "explosion" occupying one tile.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class demolition.Entity

        animationState, currentFrame, frames, gameTime, x, y

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Explosion(processing.core.PImage image, int x, int y)
      Constructs a new, temporary Explosion object that kills Characters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkDisappear()
      Checks whether the explosion is ready to disappear.
      void tick()
      Updates the entity by one tick (1/60 of a second) and handles relevant internal events.

      • Methods inherited from class demolition.Entity

        draw, setFrames, updateFrame

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Explosion

        public Explosion(processing.core.PImage image,
                 int x,
                 int y)
        Constructs a new, temporary Explosion object that kills Characters.
        Parameters:
        image - The explosion's image to be drawn.
        x - The x-coord of the explosion.
        y - The y-coord of the explosion.

      • checkDisappear

        public boolean checkDisappear()
        Checks whether the explosion is ready to disappear. If true, it should be removed externally.
        Returns:
        Whether the explosion is ready to disappear.
